column3:
There's another one here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/main.cpp#L3453

Edit: and here https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/net.cpp#L1974  although arguably, it's less important as it only logs outgoing messages.
Hmm, can't we call sanitize on the command string directly on input instead later on every LogPrint?\n

The problem here is the output, hence the point is to sanitize on _output_, not the input. Operations on valid input may still result in output strings that are 'dangerous'. Filtering out the characters on input would result in the counter-intuitive behavior that `"get\x1bblock"`is an alias for `"getblock"` (for another example of input and output sanitization being confused only look as far as PH

@laanwj good catch; I saw the one at 1974 but because it was outgoing I didn't hit it. Since it caught your attention to, I'll just add it; better than people in the future spending time thinking about it being okay or not.\n
